page.title: 01HILLS WEST OF HARWOOD DALE
page.content: The east section is lowest and has the most farms and habitation along the only tarmac road and the Lownorth Park Valley . Pleasant mixed farmland and deciduous woods and in north east a large coniferous plantation. The south has deciduous woods and are dominated by high flat topped forested hills to the south. The south east section is planted with conifers and the north east risen up to heather dominated moorland beyond the large grass fields on the slope. The residents are nearly all farmers and there are no villages so most of the land is used for farming and forestry and perhaps grouse shooting in the north east. A motorcycle club also runs owns some land at Lownorth Park. The whole block is in National Park and attracts tourists for the day to walk and enjoy the countryside.
